comments.message: Why do you select A1 after selecting B1 ?
Hmm... there is actually no need of all this stuff of entering text and making selection. I'm going to remove it.

Why is it done here? This isn't related to the stripping of the character at line break at all. This is related to #i3952#, and Word counts SIX-PER-EM SPACE height, unlike FOUR-PER-EM SPACE.

See tdf#153136.
I'm going to remove this character from the condition again (and add correct ones); please tell if there is a real need for it here (in which case, you need to find a proper place for the change, not here).
If I right remember, I wanted to keep the layout at the end of the lines, but it's possible that I made a mistake. Mike, many thanks for the fix and your feedback!
Why do you repeat this each time?
Done
Document what these numbers are?
not sure what this is, also an index?
https://gerrit.libreoffice.org/c/core/+/155036
This is not needed anymore
Indeed; dropped in PS3
Is this still used?
In https://opengrok.libreoffice.org/xref/core/basic/source/classes/sbxmod.cxx?r=8da305ac#1634
Done
Why the rename?
Because it had aAbs as the value returned from the test, where as with the destructure we end up with the close sAbs - it seemed too close to have aAbs and sAbs.
Can you explain why is this needed? We already default to false internally. Or is this a leftover?
You're right, I believe it should be possible to remove this.
Actually, when I tried removing it didn't work properly anymore (it enabled the flag for legacy documents), so I guess it really is necessary for some reason.

> Actually, when I tried removing it didn't work properly anymore

Which locale do you use in your setup? I'd assume that it's the code in unotools/source/config/compatibility.cxx; and this code looks questionable to me: why the locale-specific behavior is needed here? The option is there. Why not just keep it uniform?

Yeah, I wanted to leave that up for debate. It would have been neat for it to work like that out of the box, because then I believe there wouldn't be any reason not to add autocorrect rules to resolve 46770, however having it uniform is also neat in a different way.


> Which locale do you use in your setup?
I tried with "cs" and "en", and while it works correctly for "en", it doesn't for "cs" (as described).

After removing the locale specific code in question from compatibility.cxx, it stopped working for "en" too, shoving the flag absolutely everywhere. I feel like that's not the expected behaviour, but not sure what I'm missing.
I figured it out, I mismatched array of strings to an enum.
Done
Why `o3tl::span`? `aNames` could be used in range-for directly.
Done
This variable is not needed anymore.
Done
Also, this variable is not needed.
Done

Now why all these commented lines?
Either they're useless and you can remove them or they're useful and you must let them.
Forget it, it was already commented.
Why do we want to include deleted parts? This results broken hyperlinks, when w:del is there before w:ins in the DOCX file.

If the command line is empty or contains only a space, the item not deleted must be added. Of course, this is only necessary for change tracking, otherwise you don't need to check anything, just add it.

I have attached a new test document to the bug report (created in MSO), which shows the remaining problem. When I checked the first commit, I noticed, that m_nToken cleared before processing all parts of the comment, so we must keep it somehow, maybe using delInstText.
Ack
curious: why treat zero separately?
Just an idea, but I can drop it, sure.
Done
i'm not seeing what is the replacement for this call?
TBL_BOXATR is never used on UpdateTableFields -- all uses have been replaced by SwTable::SwitchToInternal....
Do you mean this? :-)
Aha!
Why do you add listener in dtor?
I had some inheritance issues :). ( meanwhile My Brain :| "what should I say...what should I say...")
Why do you think this may happen? And from where this negative value may come from? Can you check this right now, and not in runtime?

Sorry for my late reply. This was intended as "fuse" for the future. As you said, right now only positive values seem to be involved (I didn't check at runtime, just read the sources). However, if someone alters the addNew method in future, making it returning negative values too, we have at least some kind of warning.
Leave the warning there or go back to patch set 2?
I think these warning is not needed. Please drop the changes in this part.
Done

You can say:
 xContextNode does not exist!
Done

You can say:
 xContextNode interface pointer does not exist.
Done
Don't you have to restore the old state when you leave this scope? Possibly that's why some other test in the suite breaks now.
Probably. I thought it didn't matter because when I tried to set it BEFORE loadandsave it did nothing. But probably that was because there was no mxcomponent or something like that....
Done

what you want here is

    static bool inUnitTest = getenv("LO_TESTNAME") != nullptr

like we do elsewhere

Thanks for the tip about the LO_TESTNAME environment variable. Looks like SalInstance::IsRunningUnitTest() is a convenient static method to check that environment variable so I used that in patch set 2.
